author: {'steamid': '76561198072127164', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1640448600}
review:
I really enjoy it when I discover old games on Steam. Not only do they add to the already enormous store page that we see here, but when you discover some old treasures, it brings back that sweet nostalgia. In my case, this game did exactly that. Way back when I had my Sony VAIO PCV-RX850 Desktop and a Windows XP operating system, I used to run this game on a disc. Remember back then when that's how you played a game on PC, before Steam Games?

As for the game, I would highly recommend it for people who already played it back in 2003. Being able to obtain this game again through Steam is a joy. As for you newcomers...

The game itself has decent graphics. The game was well made for its time. The story is well done and enjoyable. Not anything extraordinary, but quite the typical Indiana Jones story you would expect, with Jones visiting different areas of the pre-war world, having a female lead, encountering a rival, exploring ancient ruins and defeating Nazi's. 

Bugs are more common in games that were made in the age before paches, but I've rarely had any experience with bugs in this title. Well made game in overall. For those who can enjoy games regardless of graphics or complex gameplay mechanics, I would recommend cheking this game out. There are tons of YouTube videos about it, and I dare say that any true gamer will have a fun experience playing as the daring Dr. Jones on his adventure to find the Emperor's Tomb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013728022', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1586115624}
review:
Had a great time with this. The levels are short, but oh so satisfying when you unlock the exits or solve the puzzles and you get that classic tune kicking in to mark your success.

While the character model of Indy looks like his life is pain, I think it's fantastic that the developers added the hat animations. You'll see what I mean when you play.

A little frustrating with the controls to begin with, which also don't really operate in your favour at one particular segment towards the end of the game - but honestly, this is a brilliant addition to the Indiana Jones franchise.

review: If the Holocaust didn't make you hate Nazis, this game sure will.  I played this game as a child but never beat it.  I picked it up on Steam for the nostalgia and it is a lot harder to beat than I remember.  I made it a point to beat it today ( only takes appx. 10-12 hours ) and must have died a hundred times.  Still, the storyline was absolutely amazing and I had great fun playing it and reliving old memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965193437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1585658080}
review:
If you want your dose of 3D Indiana Jones Action/puzzle/platform game here it is. From the great company called LucasArts.

That is on a few conditions tho : there are section where the game simply becomes trial and error, and with no manual saving you are bound to replay ALOT of those levels. Also the graphics are kind of dated, and the controls take a long time getting used too. The game can crash alot too.

That aside it's still a great game and probably the last good Indiana Jones game made to date. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092973880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1584303514}
review:
A truly forgotten LucasArts gem.

Has it aged well? In some regards, yes, it still has a great story and it really makes you feel like you are Indy. However, there are some frustrating aspects of the game such as the camera and being unable to save mid-level.

I have memories of this game on PS2 and renting it from Blockbuster back in the day. I love it. And it was a pleasure to play through it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093386701', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1667828815}
review:
I played this game on the first xbox, and it was one of my favorite, and i remember struggling so much as a kid on this game
This game is still good today, all of the gameplay designs are good, fist-fight, platformer with riddles and hidden traps, a lot of differant weapons to use, until you get knocked down and an enemy grab your weapon to get vengeance
The fist fight is really the way to go, it's intuitive, with quick and heavy strikes, a grab, a lot of different combos; it feel brutal and in normal difficulty you're quite fragile, getting hit too much makes you vulnerable for the levels to come (don't forget to block, even in if caught in the middle of a combo, indy can recover after a few hit and will start blocking unarmed attacks, you obsiously can't block knives and machetes bare handed)
The atmosphere too is really good, it truly feel like an indiana jones adventure, the music, the sound effects, the cheezy humor, the plot is nice  even if quite forgetable but the levels design are really good (for an xbox of course, but it has not aged that bad i'd say)
It really feel like developpers tried their best to make a fun but not so easy game

Only downside are the absence of checkpoint during levels and a lot of (short) loading screens, but hey, makes it more authentic
I had a blast playing it again, but maybe it's just nostalgia
if you ever played a tomb raider and enjoyed it, you can enjoy this game in my opinion

author: {'steamid': '76561198345808911', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1651365473}
review: Surprisingly pretty good despite some jankiness with cameras and lack of saving within levels. Combat can be a little confusing and there are a lot of infuriating sections but with every death or mistake you learn a little more about a level and what to do which adds some rather nice feelings of progress once a level is completed. Stays pretty true to source material too, some supernatural, some Germans inexplicably in a secret base, pretty varied combat segments, platforming, and puzzles. All in all I recommend it if you can handle dying a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165213818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1689568564}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a fantastic game, albeit with some issues.  

Cons
Story: The plot is almost non-existent and it has little time for downtime.  The game is from 2003 and a 3D platformer/action game at heart, so this grievance is not unexpected, but it is disappointing.  
Saving: The checkpoint system is horrendous. You cannot save your game in the middle of a level, and you must repeat the entire section from the beginning if you die, or even more frustratingly, if you have to leave.  This point is fairly subjective, as it does add to the difficulty of the game, but I personally do not consider it worthwhile.  
Crashing: For whatever strange reason, the game crashes when minimized.  
Historical Representation: Prague is in Bavaria, the map borders in the cutscenes are from 2003, and the Turkish mercenaries are dressed more like Arabs.  These, and a few other nitpicks, might be minor to some, but they do sadly detract from the experience a bit for those looking for a bit more authenticity.  

Neutral
Underwater Controls: Controls for the water levels take a minute to get fully accustomed to, but they are not awful.  
Voice Acting: Mei Ying's voice actress, Vivian Wu, is absolutely terrible.  I am glad that they tried to be authentic by hiring a Chinese actress, but her English acting is terrible here.  David Esch does a decent job at capturing Harrison Ford's voice while absolutely nailing his demeanor.  The rest of the main cast are fine.  The voice acting for the German thugs is of a "so bad it's good" quality.  
Occult: The occult has been in Indiana Jones since the first film, but it was always kept to a minimum in the classic films.  Here, the more fantastical elements play a bigger role.  I would compare it more with the other two prior Indiana Jones titles "Fate of Atlantis" and "Infernal Machine" in regards to how far they take the more wild material.  I personally did not have much of an issue with it, but for those expecting nothing crazier beyond the ark or the grail, you may be disappointed. 

Pros
Gameplay: Platforming is fun and, from my experience, quite accurate with only a few jumps that felt unfairly punished.  Climbing feels intense but satisfactory to execute.  Combat feels stiff, but in a way that suits Indiana Jones.  As Indiana Jones is mid thirties and often fighting against people with as much (if not more) combat experience as Jones, the "dirty" feeling works extremely well here and replicates the films perfectly.  Puzzles are also sound and can provide some challenge while not feeling overwhelming.  
Locations: The areas picked for the game are all excellent, and I have zero complaints.  Outside of Xian and the titular "emperor's tomb," you get to travel everywhere from Istanbul to Ceylon to Prague to a Nazi submarine base and more.  
Graphics: For a game of 2003, the graphics look outstanding.  Compared to Lucas Arts other adventure game of 2003, Jedi Academy, it is absolutely impressive.  I would believe someone if they said it came out in 2006.  
Soundtrack: Possibly the greatest aspect of the game.  Even if this review does not sell you, I still recommend at least listening to some of the wonderful score that Clint Bajakian made for this game.  It captures the spirit of the films and John Williams style spectacularly while still being original enough to hold its own.  
Pricing: The game is $6 at the moment, which is asking for very little.  If you still do not want to spend so much on a game nearing 17 years of age, then a sale should hopefully drop it down to just a few dollars.  

Ultimately, while flawed, I would wholeheartedly recommend the game to any Indiana Jones fans out there.  While the story is not great, it nevertheless captures the spirit of the movies expertly, and it truly allows you to feel just like Indiana Jones.  Absolutely check it out if your curious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032294493', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1580859901}
review: Przygoda ukończona w 20h. Gra została podzielona na dość krótkie poziomy (ogółem 56) bez możliwości zapisu gry w dowolnym momencie co w pewnych momentach może zniechęcić gracza. Z drugiej strony krótkie sesje okazały się przyjemne. W grze występuje bardzo dużo nawiązań głównie do Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom. Kłuje w serce brak możliwości aktywnego korzystania z mapy, która występuje niestety jedynie w trzech pierwszych poziomach i jest całkowicie zbędna w porównaniu do Infernal Machine. Sterowanie nie należy do najbardziej miodnych. Irytuje muzyka w menu startowym, a także cutscenki włączające się za każdym razem przy rozpoczęciu poziomu. Twórcy postawili na dynamizm gry i praktycznie ciągłą walkę z przeciwnikami nawet w opuszczonych miejscach co wydaje się bez sensu. Mimo wszystko tytuł obowiązkowy dla każdego fana Indiany. Poszukiwacze przygód muszą także uważać by nie zgubić kapelusza podczas przechodzenia poziomu :) 5-6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198936524496', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1580872088}
review: As far as game design goes, it's okay. It's more combat than exploration, and the combat has some meat to it, but the controls are clunky; they're more jarring than those of The Infernal Machine, whose methodical level design I really enjoyed. But what made me throw in the towel here was a puzzle section that involved explicitly occult imagery, and... I did not want to get into that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045420224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1580504495}
review:
The thing that I enjoyed about this game was finishing it. As someone who is an avid fan of Indiana Jones, I mean this from the best place in my heart when I say this game is absolutely terrible. The only way I could see this being worth your time is if you wanted to play this game solely for the purpose of nostalgia. Even then, that, in my opinion, should be a solidly debatable decision.

The whole game feels like a chore. The problems make game play extremely tiring. Sometimes enemies will annoyingly keep doing combo moves on you, and you're left there to sit until they're finished. Camera angles are some of the worst I've ever encountered. Want to walk against a ledge and look to the direction you're going? Nope. That would make sense; let's make it so you're looking at an angle that you can easily fall from. 
Would you like to save the game? You're at a pretty decent spot. No. You're going to have to complete the whole checkpoint, we want to make sure you lose all your progress in this particular section until you finish it in its entirety. Also, we're going to replay annoying-as-hell cutscenes every time you die. Sure, we'll let you skip them, but you're going to have to watch at least a few seconds of it. We want to make sure you're given at least a slight headache every time. 

Now, I get that the game is going-on-17-years-old, but it just doesn't hold up today, at all. I would love to see a well done Indiana Jones game sometime in the future, and this is definitely not one. It's a solid no from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140752892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1580010690}
review:
The word to describe this game is CLUNKY.

The story is CLUNKY. Its too fast paced with the connection between Indy and Mei Ling feeling very forced and unearned. Weird things that don't belong in Indiana Jones are littered everywhere. From genetic super soldiers to a LITERAL KRAKEN. The villains are cookie cutter with barely any personality.

The gameplay is CLUNKY. The basic moment to moment gameplay is fine but nothing special. The controls are stiff, making platforming terrible. Auto aim barely ever works even when your target is right in front of your target. There are some enemies that have combo moves that are super cheap. The death screen is super long and unskipable. 

The presentation is CLUNKY. It looks like a low res XBox game. The character models are nothing special with them not having that much emotion besides basic mouth movements. You can easily tell when the background begins. Music gets very repetitive. Indy breathes super loudly every 5 seconds which gets on your nerves VERY quickly. 

And the save system is TERRIBLE. There are no check points or manual save. You can only "save" progress every time you finish a level. So you can be near the end of a 10 minute level only to not jump correctly because of the controls and have to start the whole level all over again. Its the worst aspect of the game. That and the unskipable death screen.

Overall, not the worst game ever but definitely CLUNKY

5/10

review: Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb - игра 2003 года ,которая для многих стоит в ряду с KOTOR,Jedi Academy, Uncharted и The Fate of Atlantis.Стоит она в этом ряду из-за весёлого геймплея (различные способы выбивания дерьма из противника радуют), неплохого сюжета(некоторые сюжетные моменты интересны),отличной музыки(всё в духе фильмов) и духа охоты за сокровищами("Jackpot!").Если являетесь фанатом приключений Индианы Джонса,то с игрой стоит ознакомиться.

review:
Bis heute mein absolutes Lieblingsgame.
Habe es bereits 2 mal auf Disc jedoch ließ es sich nicht mehr auf Win7 installieren.(Danke an VAlve an dieser Stelle fürs Veröffentlichen <3)
Tolle Indy-typische Story, mega Engine und Optik für 2003.
Ich persönlich komme mega gut mir der Steuerung zurecht(Kenne aber mehrere die damit noch nicht ganz zurecht kommen).
Ich wünsche mir von keinem Spiel mehr ein Remake als von "Indy und die Legende der Kaisergruft".

author: {'steamid': '76561198883173711', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1610133161}
review:
This game is still a masterpeice after 16 years thats both amazing and sad.
Its amazing because the game holds up pretty well after 16 years and the mechanics are really good!
The sad part is that we didnt get a better Indiana Jones game after 16 years.
And its sad that this game is very underrated.
If you still somehow didnt play this game before you HAVE TO PLAY IT its amazing!
5 dollars for this game is WORTH THE MONEY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103926212', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1647827390}
review:
If you've owned the game and you have fond memories of it then I would definitely recommend this game to you. Controls feel pretty alright, frame rate is locked at 30 and the resolution is capped pretty low too, it's a game released in 2003 after all, but it's a blast from the past.

If you have never played then I wouldn't recommend buying it unless it's on sale and you're looking for a game to burn 8 to 12 hours on. You may find yourself getting frustrated with camera controls and the platforming from time to time as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128503681', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1693409969}
review:
Indiana Jones y la Tumba del Emperador es, al igual que el resto de juegos de Indy una completa pasada.
Este juego marcó mi infancia de una forma abismal, tiene una calidad gráfica y técnica sensacional para la época, incluso a día de hoy se sigue viendo genial. Tuve la suerte de conocer este juego y jugarlo tanto en PC como en PS2, tiene una historia muy entretenida y momentos inolvidables.
Lo recomiendo al máximo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842011409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1543396032}
review:
Akcja gry dzieje się w 1935r. Przygodę zaczynamy w dawnym Cejlonie. Jones ma do zdobycia posążek Kouru Watu. Po zdobyciu figurki na drodze stają nam nazistowscy żołnierze, którymi dowodzi Albrecht von Beck. Nieudane starcie z nimi jest przejściem do kolejnej części gry, którą zaczynamy na uniwersytecie, gdzie wizytę składa nam chiński marszałek Kai Ti Chan i jego asystentka. Przedstawiają nam historię Serca Smoka (Czarnej Perły), cesarskiego skarbu pochowanego wraz z nim samym. Zdobywca skarbu posiądzie moc kontroli nad umysłami. Do wyruszenia w niebezpieczną przygodę potrzebne nam będzie zdobycie Zwierciadła Snów, dzięki któremu będzie można przejść przez Grobowiec Cesarza (stąd nazwa gry) oraz dostać się do samej krypty. Czarna Perła została podzielona na trzy części i wraz z nami szukają ich również niemieccy żołnierze oraz chińskie gangi. Po drodze natkniemy się na liczne pułapki, wrogich ludzi, groźnie zwierzęta oraz tzw, Bossów na końcu każdego etapu. Zmierzymy się również z siłami nadprzyrodzonymi. Będziemy mieli do rozwiązania masę zagadek oraz sprawdzenie umiejętności fizycznych do pokonywania kolejnych etapów. Gra skrywa również ukryte miejsca.
 Na wyposażeniu mamy słynne lasso i manierkę na wodę służąca do napełniania paska energii, a do zdobycia jest kilka rodzajów broni. 
 Gra ma charakter na wpół interaktywny co pozwala na np. rozbicie skrzyni w celu wydobycia z niej czegoś lub przesunięcie jej aby wejść wyżej, 
 Muzykę zawdzięczamy Orkiestrze Symfonicznej pod batutą Clinta Bajakiana, która będzie się zmieniała w zależności od sytuacji w grze, Ciekawą wstawką są też przemyślenia głównego bohatera, które posłużą jako podpowiedzi. 
 Grafika gry ze względu na technologię z roku wydania nie powala na kolana, ale zdecydowanie nadrabia grywalnością. Czasem ma się odczucie, że w grze brakuje "tego czegoś", ale jak na tamte czasy to i tak jest bardzo dobrze, Szkoda, że nie doczekaliśmy się kontynuacji serii bo jak każdy, kto zna tą serię wie, że Indiana Jones miał ogrom przygód, które świetnie nadają się na kolejne części tej gry.  
 Moja ocena 8/10 przez niektóre niedociągnięcia, ale wiadomo, że w tamtym roku technologia komputerowa nie pozwalała nam jeszcze na tak wiele jak to ma miejsce obecnie.
 Mogę śmiało polecić grę graczom lubiącym taki rodzaj rozrywki.

author: {'steamid': '76561199005777655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1689609051}
review:
when i was a kid, i was obsessed with Indiana Jones. I eventually found out this game existed, but at the time, i didn't have any of the old consoles that the title could be played on. I was bummed, and always wanted to play this game. When I found it on steam, i was so excited and downloaded it instantly.

My review on it:
This game is marvelous. Considering the very few 3D Indiana Jones videogames, this one takes the cake for the best, and still is worth playing to this day.

Pros:
Fun gameplay
Ok graphics
Good control scheme (can be binded to your liking)
Good voice acting and sound affects

Cons:
Clunky swimming controls

Out of 10, I give this game an 8. Considering its only issue is clunky controls in swimming, this game is an absolute fun game to play, and will keep you busy for hours, and its going for a cheap price too. So get your hands on this game ASAP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198323460470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1575235721}
review:
Graphics and camera control are slightly dated now but still totally workable
There is a great variety in levels and the bosses are fun too
Normal difficulty poses a challenge and yet is not too hard to have fun with.
However some of the save points are very spaced apart so it can be frustrating having to lose lots of progress
Would give it an 8/10. Gives you that classic Indy feeling when the music kicks in!

review: Frustrating checkpoints, on top of the fact that when you accidentally press the windows key the game crashes. Also, sharks and gators are not fun and their AI is extremely weird. author: {'steamid': '76561198099860224', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5551, 'last_played': 1647872811}
review:
As a child, one of my favourite passtimes was playing this game's levels over and over, just pummeling nazis for hours on end. The combat system is that good. When I discovered that this gem was on steam last year, I picked it up without a second thought.

As it turns out, 21 year old me still loves to play levels over and over to kill nazis with my bare hands. When I am bored and have nothing else to do, I know I can't go wrong with some IJET.

This game's amazingly fun. That's the word I'd use to describe it, everything about it is just so much [i]fun[/i]. The camera's a little clunky, and it uses a Dark Souls-esque control scheme by default (which I don't have a problem with, myself, but plenty of people do), but the platforming's fun and intuitive and the puzzles are interesting enough.

The combat system is, without a doubt, the best part of the game. I swear, this game has to have some of the most satisfying fist fights ever. Indy can do all sorts of punch combos that'll destroy his foes, throw enemies off cliffs or into walls (even into other enemies! Nobody misses out on the fun!), put them in a headlock and just pummel away, pull them closer with his whip for a punch to the nose, pistol whip them, use magical artifacts to eradicate ghouls... or, he can just shoot everyone. Guns are hopelessly overpowered in this game, and they're also not that fun to use, since the game has autoaim. I recommend just forgetting about guns and going with your fists the entire way. It's both more challenging and enjoyable that way.

Graphically, it's honestly pretty impressive for its age. It has mediocre resolution settings and a 30 FPS cap, but they're very easy to fix, won't take more than five minutes. There's a guide here on steam that explains how to do it, you cannot miss it. Once you've got it running at 60 FPS and at a tolerable resolution, the game almost looks five years ahead of its time. It also works magnificently: in my nearly 100 hours of game time on Windows 10 (notorious for breaking older games), I have experienced maybe one or two crashes during the gameplay - at most. 
[strike]The game does break when I try going to the desktop, but that might be an issue on my end.
[/strike]
EDIT (06/01/2022): At the time of writing, a member of the community has found a fix for this pesky bug. Look for the "Render Error Fix" guide here on Steam, by Doktor Headshot. It's a really simple fix and it works like a charm. Awesome work, Doktor!

This game's got no shortage of minor glitches, but I've yet to find a gamebreaking bug. Frankly, the glitches only add to the experience. At the time of writing (and if I didn't screw up the counting), I've got 74 screenshots of this game uploaded to my profile. Around 90% of those are of funny glitches that I encountered. My personal favourite is getting Indy to drink from a beaker full of acid. It may be just me here, but glitch-hunting's half the fun of this game. They're like nifty little easter eggs. Here's one you can try at home: operate a lever while you're drinking water from your canteen. Indy will pull the lever in a... rather peculiar manner.

As for the story, it's... all right. No match for Raiders or Crusade, but one thing I appreciate is that, rather than trying to emulate Indy's best hits, this game goes in a different direction. The story is, as a result, completely unique. It does get a bit ridiculous by the end, and the cutscenes are, sadly, the part of the game that has aged the most poorly. Still, the game feels like a real Indy movie, even if it's not as good as the real Indy movies, and I can commend them for that. Voice acting is pretty good, too.

Much like the story, the soundtrack, while a bit worse than John Williams's scores, is pretty kick-ass. Each area has its own leitmotifs, too, which helps give the locations their own identity. It's great stuff.

All in all, absolutely fantastic game. Fans of Indy will love it, I'm sure. For everyone else, there's the fist fights.

Now if you'll excuse me, I think those agents at Prague are needing their daily pummeling. Ha!

review:
This is a fantastic entry into the Indiana Jones series the puzzle are great the locations awesome to look even today in my opinion and for not being a combat game the combat system is one of the better that I have seen in anything, it’s fast it’s smart and it makes use of your surroundings. I should also mention that there are several artifacts that are hidden throughout the different levels so there is definitely replay value here.

I would highly recommend this game if you like adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263943246', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1673292463}
review:
Hra mého fuckin´ dětství!

Takových dobrých 5-6 let jsem tuhle hru neviděl, a když jsem ji zahlédl na steamu nemohl jsem odolat :D
Hned po spuštění mě nostalgie zahřála u srdce... Otevřely se mi hezké vzpomínky na ty časy, když jsem seděl s bráchou u počítače a hráli jsme spolu tuhle hru.

Hratelnost je velice dobrá, semtam trošku repetetivní, ale to nevadí, protože je ta hra velice zábavná. Na svou dobu (rok 2003) je graficky, příběhově a hratelnostně velice obsáhlá a nabízí toho opravdu hodně.

V podstatě ani nevím, co víc vám o téhle hře říct než jen: Za těch 5e se to vyplatí.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987116285', 'num_games_owned': 1869, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1568322203}
review:
Un jeu vraiment sympa à jouer, avec Harrison Ford, la voix d'Indy (au moins en vf, sûrement en vo aussi), et les musiques qui vont avec ! Que du bon, on prend plaisir à jouer :) jusqu'à ce qu'on trouve l'histoire trop longue, parce que au final, on l'a vu venir, l'histoire, non contentes de nous faire bouffer du nazi, part dans les choux avec un aspect magico-ésotérico-mystique... 

Et c'était sans compter la caméra d'époque qui peut s'avérer super pénible, les séquences de plateform-ing qui peuvent parfois être super reloues, et cette impression que la fin du jeu est bâclée, les séquences finissent par s'enchaîner sans cinématique de changement de pièce, on comprend plus vraiment ce qui se passe, à un moment le méchant nazi resurgit de nulle part une dernière fois, puis quelques niveaux improbables, et paf ! c'est fini !!!

Oui, l'histoire a des longueurs et des aspects qui ont fini par me saouler, mais je recommande quand même de jouer ce jeu, c'est un des meilleurs Indiana Jones, après les 3 premiers films !! ;) ;) ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1556428630}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Ja (persönliche Wertung: 6/10)

Errungenschaften: Nein

Positiv:
- Indiana Jones
- Gute Story

Negativ:
- Plumpe Steuerung
- Zu wenig Speicherpunkte --> Frust

Fazit:
Na da ist mir ja mal ein Schatz in die Hände gefallen! Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb ist ein klassisches Abenteuerspiel. Was für mich anfänglich aussah wie ein dahingeklatschtes Spiel, welches parallel zu einem Film erschienen ist, entpuppte sich als einen kurzweiligen Spaß. Zu der Story sage ich nichts, da jeder sich selbst davon überzeugen sollte das diese gut gelungen ist.
Das Spiel hat natürlich auch so seine Macken... Die Steuerung ist manchmal etwas plump, die Grafik ist auch nicht die schönste und die rar gesäten Speicherpunkte sorgen an mancher Stelle zu Frust. Ich will nicht wissen, wie oft ich von ein und dem selben Krokodil gefressen wurde... Dennoch kann das Spiel mit einigen Spielmechaniken glänzen, von denen heutige Spiele sich etwas abschneiden können. Der größte Pluspunkt ist jedoch dieser: Indiana Jones! DA DA DA DAAAAA DA, DA DA DAAAAA DA, DA DA DAAA DAA DAAAAA DEEEE, DA DA DA DA DA... Kurz gesagt: Ein gelungenes Spiel und definitiv Empfehlenswert!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062739674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1635750187}
review:
[h1]"Ch'in Shi Huang, First Emperor of China. Hmm... looks pretty good, all things considered.[/h1]
[i]Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb[/i] was a real trip down memory lane. It is a very nostalgic game for me, having been one that I played for countless hours when I was a kid. I saw it for sale for a pretty paltry sum, and decided I might as well play through it again! I found, to my delight, that the game was actually much as I remembered it - the first few levels are definitely the best, there's a sudden difficulty spike as you reach Istanbul, and the later levels of the game range from tough and atmospheric - I remember they used to be even scary - to bland and forgettable. There's a series of Nazi submarine base levels that are just wandering through hallways and punching Nazis in the face, which is fun for a while, but when there's little meaningful platforming or even the light puzzling the game offers, then the game becomes a drag. But mostly, the level design is on point, and the fist-fighting is probably the second best I've seen in a game, just behind [i]Batman: Arkham[/i].

[b]Gameplay[/b]
You play as the legendary Indiana Jones - before the events of any of the films - but still a hardened explorer. It is a third person action/adventure game in which you can shoot, leap, interact and punch. The shooting is generally done via auto-aim, though there are one or two on-rail turret sequences and you can go into the relatively ineffective first person mode. The platforming can be pretty finicky, though it really is just something that takes getting used to. 
By far the highlight of the gameplay segment is the brawling and fist-fighting. Using the left and right mouse buttons, you tell Indy to swing. Hammering them both at the same time grabs the foe by the collar and you can smack them around a bit, throw them off ledges, into tables, or just kick them in the groin, toss them to the ground, and kick them some more. Indy is a pragmatic fighter. He makes use of table and chair legs, bottles, or just chairs themselves, as well as his trusty whip, which he uses to disarm the variety of Nazis or cultists that he finds through the story. 
You collect and manage a relatively small inventory, and heal yourself by collecting medkits and refilling Indy's trusty canteen of water. 
There are some swimming sections, which would be pretty boring if they weren't invariably inhabited by the most terrifying crocodiles in video games, and sometimes sharks too. 
It's worth noting that the puzzles are generally pretty easy - could have been a lot more challenging, but that's okay. It keeps the game moving along and the pacing generally feels tight.  
All in all, the gameplay still holds up very well to this day, and if you're a fan of Indiana Jones, this game really does make you feel like Indiana Jones - every *thwack* is infinitely satisfying. 

[b]Story[/b]
While it certainly isn't an award-winning story, and inferior to the first three movies, I always thought that this game's story could be adapted and revised for the big screen instead of what we got in the [i]Crystal Skull[/i]. Indy is recruited to find the artifacts that will lead him to the First Emperor of China's tomb, and you go all over the world in suitable Indy fashion - from Ceylon, to Prague, to Hong Kong, all the locales are visually very distinct and the levels can be challengingly designed, although generally fair. The story carries on at a rapid pace, as discussed earlier, and there are a few revelations, though nothing you can't see coming. There's one weird cutscene just before the final boss that's kind of weird and unexplained, but other than that, I really do like the story. I would have liked to have seen more Mei Ying in the Indy mythos later on.

[b]Graphics, Sound and Atmosphere[/b]
The graphics are pretty dated by now, of course - all you have to do is look at the screenshots to see that. But honestly, the character models are all distinct, recognizable and the locales all have their own art styles. There is a fix for the resolution online, too. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1618326824]Check out this great guide.[/url]
The sound is just really amazingly good. The Raider's March kicks in at just the right time during the combat, and the atmospheric stingers are distinct and recognizable. The voice acting is pretty good, too - some of the time. Other times, it's pretty stilted and weird. Another reason I would have loved for this story to be adapted to a big screen or even just re-invisioned or remastered. 
The atmosphere makes you feel like Indiana Jones, exploring ancient tombs, punching Nazis, cultists or escaping angry wildlife. It's great. It's just great. If you want to feel like Indiana Jones, even if just for a few hours, play this game. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
It's a game that makes you [i]feel[/i] like Indiana Jones. And I mean, how else can I sell this game? In a world that's sorely lacking in Lucasarts games - I mean, why are there such a distinct lack of [i]Star Wars[/i], [i]Indiana Jones[/i] and all these other great IPs games? It's honestly just pretty sad. In the mean time, play [i]The Emperor's Tomb[/i]. It's fun, it's B-movie esque, it's all those Indiana Jones tropes you've come to love and expect. 
Go ahead. 
Punch a Nazi in the face. You know you want to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183502562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1677767092}
review:
Um jogo que recomendo, mas apenas para fãs do Indiana Jones, pois tirando isso não é um jogo que envelheceu muito bem, principalmente na parte dos controles, que são um tanto imprecisos. Outra coisa que vale mencionar é a falta de variedade de falas do Indiana Jones e dos inimigos, quando você pega um item explosivo por exemplo, ele só tem duas frases, que são: ''I'll try to not blow myself up'' e ''Boom'' e ao menos pra mim, foi algo que no começo achei engraçado, porém mais para o final do jogo me incomodou um pouco.

 Os inimigos também tem pouquíssimas falas, eles geralmente falam sempre as mesmas coisas, só mudando a língua já que há fases em países diferentes.
A parte gráfica achei boa, não é o melhor gráfico que tinha quando saiu pra ps2, mas consegue ter alguns ambientes bonitos. 

Os controles, como mencionei antes, são bem imprecisos, especialmente nas fases que tem que nadar, fazer isso no teclado e mouse é horrível, você se confunde com frequência, e quando tem inimigos te perseguindo então, aí é que as coisas fodem de verdade. Outra coisa em que a imprecisão dos controles afeta bastante é o combate, que é muito bom com exceção disso, mas é fácil errar golpes no jogo porque o Indiana Jones não sabe onde bater, foram várias as vezes em que eu acertei o nada ao invés do inimigo, e claro, às vezes acertava o inimigo quando não era para acertar.  

O tiroteio eu achei ruim, se no combate era comum errar golpes, aqui, parece que o Indiana Jones tem algum tipo de estrabismo, porque ele erra tiros até quando os inimigos estão na frente dele, e apesar disso no começo do jogo não incomodar muito, perto da reta final do jogo vai, pois a munição vai se fazer muito necessária para avançar. É comum também ver inimigos resistindo à tiros de espingarda, mas isso é proposital. 

A dublagem é outra coisa que achei ruinzinha, o Indy com certeza não é dublado pelo Harrison Ford e a qualidade do áudio também não é boa, a atuação também não é das melhores, mas relevei por conta da época em que foi lançado, mas senti que faltou emoção em algumas falas. Ao que parece o jogo teve um baixo orçamento.

Apesar desses pontos que citei, é um bom jogo, o primeiro em que eu vi o chapéu do Indiana cair e você poder pegar ele de novo, o que eu fiz com muita frequência, pois lembrava muito o filme e dá uma sensação boa ao pegar, porém há uma coisa engraçada, que, se você pausar o jogo, o chapéu do Indiana Jones some durante a tela de pause, sabe se lá porquê.

O combate, que eu havia mencionado antes, é muito bom (quando se acerta os inimigos), é possível fazer uma pequena variedade de combos, entretanto as animações para eles são bem feitas e a reação dos inimigos é boa, fora que eles também são espertos, eles se defendem, pegam armas do chão, te agarram, pegam cobertura (isso durante o tiroteio) e até te derrubam e roubam a sua arma.

O que tenho a elogiar do jogo, além desses detalhes, é que ele realmente te faz sentir como o Indiana Jones, o que para a época em que joguei, foi algo que me deixou de boca aberta, por conta da liberdade que o jogo proporcionava, já que você podia explorar o cenário como bem entendesse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157453094', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1563737244}
review:
Not just one of the best licenced videogames of all-time but one of the greatest adventure games ever made. Indiana Jones And The Emperor's Tomb is everything you could possibly want from an Indiana Jones game and more. I'm a big fan of the Indiana Jones movies (especially the first three) so it's great to play another great title from LucasArts that really does the series justice.

You play as Indiana Jones as you embark on an epic quest that has you trekking across the globe, visiting places including Prague, Istanbul and Hong Kong. Each location is broken up into several shorter missions. The design of these is absolutely terrific as it combines the action, the puzzles and the platforming. It does a better job than any of the Tomb Raider games that I have played of blending together all three elements into a satisfying experience. This is as close as you are going to get to playing an Indiana Jones film.

Each environment looks unique and the enemies you face are also specific to each location. Expect to fight gun-toting Nazis in Prague, Arab swordsmen in Istanbul and martial artists in Hong Kong. The fighting is very fun with lots of different combos and animations as you take down your foes. You can also use an array of weapons such as guns, glass bottles, chairs and of course, your trusty whip.

I really like the way the health system is handled as you can heal yourself by drinking water from your canteen and this can be refilled at various fountains. You can also find health packs dotted around the game.

You need to keep an eye out for secret areas if you want to find all the artefacts.

The music is terrific as it is taken from the excellent John Williams score from the movies.

The graphics are very impressive for a game from 2003.

My only complaints are very minor and most can be forgiven due to the age of the game. A few of the environmental textures look very ugly and Indiana Jones' face looks a little bit off but that might have been due to some form of legal issue surrounding the use of Harrison Ford's likeness.

Also, I dislike how easily you can be hurt by fall damage. It seems every little fall will take health away from you.

This is an amazing game that you definitely need to check out if you are a fan of adventure games or the Indiana Jones franchise. Even the menu in this game is terrific. I have played other Indiana Jones games such as the Lego Indiana Jones games and the point-and-click Fate Of Atlantis game but this one is easily the best. I would love to see an official remastering or even a patch address some of the texture issues.

Gameplay: 9.5/10
Graphics: 7.5/10 (for the time)
Controls: 8/10
Replay Value: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198066538702', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1561059754}
review:
[h1] La place d'Indiana Jones et le Tombeau de l'empereur est-elle dans un musée ? [/h1]

Si aujourd'hui les jeux d'aventure ne jurent que part Lara Croft et Nathan Drake, fut un temps où Indiana Jones avait une place de choix dans ce domaine. Désormais relégué au rang de simple icône dont les fans chériront le souvenir, le professeur Jones est néanmoins revenu sur Steam pour nous faire profiter une ultime fois de sa dernière aventure.

[u][b] Un respect de l’œuvre originale... [/b][/u]

Entre les fans de la trilogie de Steven Spielberg et les gamers (ou profanes) ne connaissant pas ou peu le célèbre aventurier au chapeau, il y a fort à parier que les fans de la trilogie y trouveront sans nul doute leur compte. Le jeu reprend tous les éléments qui ont fait le succès des films, en mettant en scène des nazis convoitant un mystérieux artefact chinois, le tout servi par les musiques de John Williams et la voix française d'Indy.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777495819

Le jeu adapte avec brio certains objets phares des films. Le fouet d'Indiana est ainsi synonyme de phase de plateforme et son revolver de gunfight. Comme tout bon archéologue qui se respecte, Henry Jones voyagera à travers le globe, de Hong-Kong à Ceylan en passant par Prague.

Le jeu se paie même le luxe d'introduire quelques personnages des films, et de se composer comme le prologue du Temple Maudit. De quoi ravir, à n'en point douter, les amoureux de la trilogie.

[u][b] … au service d'un jeu simplement correct [/b][/u]

Indiana Jones et le Tombeau de l'empereur comblera de bonheur les fans, cela ne fait désormais plus l'ombre d'un doute, mais quid des joueurs venus humblement chercher une plaisante expérience d'action/aventure ?

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777496345

Ces derniers risquent d'être un brin déçu. Le scénario reste simple et convenu, la faute à des cinématiques trop peu nombreuses et des personnages caricaturaux, peu développés.

Le gameplay est quant à lui en demie-teinte. Les phases de plateforme sont hasardeuses, avec un Indiana Jones qui ne va pas toujours où on le voudrait, glissant alors bêtement dans un gouffre mortel. S'agissant des combats au corps-à-corps, ceux-ci sont plaisants, à l'inverse des gunfights, durant lesquelles il faudra mettre de côté une quelconque stratégie au profit d'une attitude plus musclée.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777496946

On notera également l'absence de checkpoint, chaque « gamer over » entraînant avec lui l'obligation de recommencer le niveau depuis le début. Frustrant, quand on sait que certains passages sont particulièrement longs. On appréciera néanmoins le fait de parcourir des niveaux variés. Enfin, s'il est regrettable de constater l'absence de véritables d'énigmes (les rares que l'on peut considérer comme telle ne solliciteront qu'une poignée de neurones), il sera toujours possible de se consoler en cherchant les artefacts disséminés ça et là dans les différents niveaux du jeu.


Ainsi, si cet Indiana Jones et le tombeau de l'empereur restera une expérience plaisante pour les fans, les « simples joueurs » risquent de se retrouver face à un jeu oscillant entre le moyen et le bon, dont les défauts risqueraient de les faire décrocher en milieu d'aventure, les chapitres 5 et 6 (sur les dix que composent le jeu) étant les plus mauvais et les moins intéressants.

[code]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198273402030', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1560883437}
review:
Познакомился с этой игрой я крайне давно, ещё в юном возрасте я пытался её пройти, но к сожалению так и не получилось. Я застрял практически в самом конце, тем самым забросив игру и вот спустя больше 10 лет, я увидел её по скидке и решил все таки допройти её, вспоминая все те эмоции, что она оставляла мне в то время. 
Ну что сказать, игру прошел, но момент когда ты убегаешь от подобия танка спустя столько лет до сих пор напрягал. 
Игра не сложная, она интересная и короткие уровни, смена декораций, в меру интересный gameplay, хотя для своего времени это было можно сказать круто. Сколько игр вы знаете про Индиану Джонса? Вот и я единицы, а стоящих? На мое мнение она относится именно к таким. 
Стоит ли её советовать сейчас? Даже не знаю, для меня это больше как не выполненный отрывок из детства, для других очередная игра. 
Хотя,  стоит её пройти, хотя бы как дань тому времени и очень хорошим одноименным фильмам.
Коротко по плюсам и минусам.
Плюсы:
-Приятная графика ( для своего времени, но и сейчас лично у меня отторжения не вызвало)
- хороший, средняковый gameplay
- интересный дизайн локаций
- музыка
- в меру длинная
Минусы:
- лёгкая, но момент с танком добивает
Ну, для меня лично это единственный минус.
Но все же оценка будет 8 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074845294', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1560699479}
review:
TLDR: much nostalgia, adventure vibes, indy voice, some levels are fun, but usually the shortest ones X the worst controls in the history of gaming, the other levels, frustrating checkpoint system

I gave Indy an approval. BUT. mostly out of nostalgia. Back in the day, when the game came out, I beat the demo in hong kong theatre a dzillion times. And I was about thirteen or fourteen years old. And I loved it. Im an Indiana Jones fan, I like the atmosphere and the adventure vibe the series has. And it also looked great back in the day too. I bought it here, and aside from the resolutions needed to be fixed and stuff (which I dont mind - I am well aware of the games age) it worked fine, I was overhyped in the first hour or so. Then I just found out this is not a good game. Sure it has its fun parts, but the levels are boring, sometimes utterly ugly, I enjoyed Indy looking like Indy and voice sounding pretty much like Harrison Ford. But right from the beginning I couldnt believe how frakked up the controls and camera angles are. I died a lot because of it. Sure sometimes because the section was hard, but like 90% of my reloads was because Indy fell somewhere because the controls messed up or camera turned somewhere for no reason and Indy followed that direction and not the one I pressed. I gotta say I played a lot of games and never in my adult playing career was I so frustrated as when playing this game. Because in combination with stupid checkpoint save system, sometimes you gotta repeat like ten fifteen minutes of gameplay just because the controls killed Indy. Too bad. I enjoyed some parts and finished it. But then I went off Into the wilderness, because I had to calm my nerves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044293868', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1560292640}
review:
A nice piece of nostalgia. And yes, the alligators still scared the shit outta me. Took about 11 hours to beat it, with a couple irritating parts. Definitely worth the full $6, or wait for a LucasArts sale.

- no issues with changing the resolution
- only crashes if you try to tab out, not a single crash otherwise
- you could probably use a third party to set up controller support, but the basic 'partial support' is missing too many buttons to use from the get go, keyboard and mouse controls work fine

author: {'steamid': '76561198125869086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1560069932}
review:
Besides Tomb Raider, this is the worst port of an old game I've ever played on Steam. Here are just some of the issues.

- The game crashes when you tab out or when the game is minimized.
- No windowed mode.
- The game crashes when you change the SCREEN RESOLUTION.
- There is game pad support but the default controls are completely nonsensical.
- There is NO D-PAD INPUT! Which means you use the PAUSE button to cycle through weapons by default. You cannot assign the D-Pad buttons to cycle through your weapons like you could in the ORIGINAL GAME on PS2 and XBOX. WTF?!

Poor show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083531248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1610503722}
review:

Not much more I can say that has not already been said. This is the best Indiana Jones action game that I've ever played. author: {'steamid': '76561198798492460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1663200076}
review:
The game is pretty good considering how old it is. Aside from the irritating camera angles and the occasionally awkward control scheme, the games hand-to-hand combat is satisfying. There is gun combat too, yet it isn't as developed and thought through. Platforming and exploration is quite linear but also well made, making you have to time your jumps and co-ordinate your plans unlike something such as uncharted. The games puzzles are relatively simple also.

Overall, the game is a fun short experience similarly to that of Uncharted or Tomb Raider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095196168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1554675080}
review:
>be me
>be 7
>Mom and dad are constantly fighting
>often can't stay in the same room together
>Christmas 2004
>Dad buys me a xbox 
>Mom buys me a bunch of games
>Open Indiana jones and the Emperors tomb
Dad: "Why did you buy him that? hes 7 he doesn't know what indiana jones even is.
Mom: "well i thought it would get him interested."
>try to play the game, buy im really too young to get it
>parents take over to help me
>mom and dad acually work together to get me through the first half
>i just sit enjoying the action and music and stuff
>parents eventually get back together some time later when little bro is born
>would go on the play the game for the next 3 years until i finally beat it.
>would go on to enjoy the good indiana jones films

>be me
>23 typical pc master race gamer
>kinda a depressed young adult with a alcohol dependency
>none of my regular online friends are on
>drunk browising the store for a cheap single player, 
>see Indiana Jones and the emperors tomb has a steam release
>heart skips a beat
>instantly buy it
>play if for the next 3 hours
>be genuinely happy for the first time in years
>Call parents, tell them how much i love them
>didn't black out on a friday night for the first time in months 

and im still playing it, stuck on that asshole squid just like the good old days, thank you lucus arts for this horribly underrated early 2000s gem, it will always hold a place in my heart as one of the deepest gaming experiences of my life. lets hope EA never tarnishes it,

author: {'steamid': '76561198039138702', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1553236971}
review:
Kısa gireceğim:

Indiana Jones and The Infernal Machine gibi bir başyapıttan yıllar sonra aynı markanın adında böyle adi bir oyun çıkartmak yakışmamış. Oyunun hikayesi orta kararda olsa da, kontrol mekanikleri genellikle sizi çıldırtacak şekilde ayarlanmış.

Oyunun Olumsuz Yanları:

- Yönetmenlik: Oyundaki hikaye anlatımı çok kötü. İyi bir "ara sahne" kurgusuyla hikaye çok çekici bir hale getirilebilirdi.
- Hikaye: Herhangi bir gizem unsuru yok. Az çok ne olacağının ipuçları en başından veriliyor. Indiana Jones and The Infernal Machine'de her bölümde ayrı bir gizem vardı.
- Müzik & Ses: Yerli yersiz çalan, atmosferden bağımsız çalan müzikler var. Bu canımı epey sıktı açıkçası, hatta bazı bölümlerde müziği tamamen kısmak zorunda kaldım. Ses efektleri ise çok sığ. Ne bulunduğunuz ortamın, ne de kullandığınız silahların herhangi bir etkisini hissedemiyorsunuz. Özellikle karakterle özdeşleşen kırbacın sesini o kadar tırt yapmışlar ki sanki ses teknisyeninin maaşını vermemişler. O kadar kötü bir ses.
- Mekanikler: Oyunu yapan arkadaşlar bir iki film izleyip, en azından önceki Indiana Jones oyunlarına bir göz atasalardı. Indiana Jones evreninin ağırlıkla "gizem", "keşif" ve eser miktarda "silahlı macera" üzerine kurulu olduğunu görürlerdi. Bu oyunda ise olay yüzde doksan yakın dövüş, onun da mekaniği rezalet. Oyunda nereye neden gittiğiniz belli değil. İlerleyiş sizi bir ülkeden bir ülkeye götürüyor ancak orada bulmaca ve keşif için sadaka niyetine bir iki dandik unsur koymuşlar.
- Atmosfer: Oyunun atmosferi on bölümden ilki ve son dördünde mevcut. Arada kalan bölümlerin ise oyun dolsun, oynama süresi uzasın diye yapıldığı ve hikayeye çok bir şey eklemediği aşikar. Herhangi bir yenilik getirmeyen uyduruk haritalarda karakteri ilerletmekten başka bir şey yapmıyoruz.

SONUÇ:

Oyunun ilk ve son dört haritasındaki hikaye anlatımı oyunun geneline uygulanabilseydi gayet idare eder bir oyun olabilirdi. Almak istiyorsanız indirime girdiğinde alın derim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983290992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1552015176}
review:
Finally! Took you long enough, Disney! But I still hate you, though.

This is a very underrated gem of the LucasArts era. A flawed masterpiece for us to hold near and dear to our hearts, made by fans of Indiana Jones to fans of Indiana Jones. I was introduced to this game when bought the film trilogy, and a trailer for this game was in the DVD with the extras. I had enjoyed a lot "Infernal Machine" on the N64, and as I moved on to PC, I bought this game for computer. And now, I decided to add it to my Steam library to revisit - to see if it still held on. And it did.

The game is a very demanding platformer, to the point it may focus more on precision over fluidity. And naturally, you use your whip to swing between platforms, because it wouldn't be an Indiana Jones game without it. 

It is clear by playing the game that developers put a strong emphasis in combat. They wanted the game to be something of a brawler, as you take on multiple enemies at once. Of course you have your guns and all that, but ammo is not that plentiful, meaning you'll get into melee combat here and there. The main issue however is that you'll see a lot of enemies being tossed in, and it gets to the point combat becomes repetitive and a little boring. But at very least, combat is fluid and not cumbersome in the least.

The level designs are the best the game has to offer. They are intuitive to solve, and this is all I ask from my adventure games: that the puzzles are not so simple to the point they might as well not be included, but that they can be solved organically, by just observing the envirioments thoroughly and deducing what the next step is. The levels, obviously, have their share of collectables, but they are not so worthy of a detour from the main path. It would be nice if they would grant you cheats - and apparently, the XBox version had cheats, but I wouldn't know anything about that in this PC port.

The graphics actually aged very well, and they really convey the places and era they represent. The art team did a fantastic job in creating those envirioments that are really immersive and impressive, but unfortunately the resolutions are in 4:3, meaning you'll have to put on with those black sidebars (unless you find some mod, but I don't want a widescreen this badly). Plus, the game seems to have poor anti-aliasing, but thank God it runs smoothly, without crashing. Meanwhile, the soundtrack is somewhat disappointing, feeling very bare and bland, like a low-budget attempt to mimic John Williams' iconic compositions for the films.

The story wants to bring Indiana Jones to the Far East - somewhere he's never been in the movies other than the intro for "Temple of Doom". So naturally, they made the game into a prequel to the movie, and (spoiler alert, I guess) at the end of your adventure there's a segway for the beginning of the film.

For fans of Jones, this game is a must, and fans of platformers and puzzle games should also give it a try, for there is much to value here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182364070', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 494, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1551311186}
review:
Beni çocukluğuma götüren bir oyun bu.
İndiana Jones olmak çok ayrı bir zevk veriyor. Kamçısını kullanabilmek, gizemleri çözmek, tehlikeler ile yüzleşmek. Hepsi birbirinden keyifli ve kendini oynatıyor.
Tek sıkıntısı kamera açısı diyebilirim ama oyunun temeli konsol olduğu için çokta dert etmedim bu konuyu. Save atma olayı da bölgeden bölgeye değiştiği için bazen ölünce ne kadar ilerlemiş de olsanız en baştan başlayabiliyorsunuz. Can sıkıcı olabiliyor bu yüzden.
İndirimlerde su fiyatına alabileceğiniz bu oyunu kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035356224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1588001857}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a third-person action-adventure game developed by The Collective, Inc. and released by LucasArts in 2003.

I am heavily biased with this game, I'll just admit that right now. This was one of the first games I played on the PlayStation 2 at the time. I remember my dad buying it at launch in June of that year and it was one of the prettiest games I had ever seen at that point. being able to just run around, climb, swim, whip over gaps, and solve puzzles was just a fantastic feeling at the time. I wasn't aware of the Tomb Raider games at that age, but from what I recall, my dad sure didn't like the controls.

Gameplay is simple Third Person affair. Get to the end of each level. There are 10 chapters, with each chapter having multiple levels/sections between them in which you traverse areas such as jungles, dungeons, astrological bell towers, aquatic ruins below Turkey, mountain bases, chinese forts, and the end of the game which takes place in a literal different dimension. Playin' as Indiana Jones you can punch the shit out of goons, grab em and toss em around, use your whipe to snatch weapons from enemies hands, or just pull your gun out and kill the fuckers cold style. Along the way you will be solving puzzles, which aren't too intensive and provide a nice balance to the action. 

Despite it's age, the game is very connected and good fun. I'm not gonna be one of those polygon or ign writing "it really makes you FEEL like indadad jodes", because that's obligatory from a title bearing the title characters name. No this game just feels like a good adventure. The game takes place before the events of Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, ends with the events that precede said film. Voice Acting is hit or miss for most people now a days, but it's serviceable, and David Esch, who takes over the character from veteran Doug Lee, (who voiced Indiana Jones in previous LucasArts titles "Fate of Atlantis" and "The Infernal Machine") does a good Indy. The music is absolutely great and captures the spirit of the franchise.

This really is just one of those games that is a product of it's era. On sale it's a dollar. Def a good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069668522', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1613479824}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a 3rd Person beat em up adventure game where you play as Indiana Jones who is trying to Recover all 3 Pieces of a Mystical Artifact called The Mirror of Dreams, The Mirror allows its user to navigate their way safely through the mysterious Emperor's Tomb, Indiana is battling against the Nazi's who want to Obtain the Heart of the Dragon to control the will of Men and gain unlimited Power. 

For a game made in 2003 the Graphics aren't so bad and some of the levels may actually look quite pretty at times, Prague, Hong Kong and Ceylon are some good Examples. Textures and Models are really good too and animations are superb, really giving you the feeling that you are kicking the Sh*t out of your enemies with over the top punches, cries of pain and grunts. 

Aside from Fist Fights you'll also be able to obtain a good variety of weapons such as Luger's, Mauser's, Grenades and the MP40 to name a few which can give you (And your enemies) the edge in combat, Indiana also has access to his Iconic whip which aside from being used to swing to different areas or make enemies back off can also be used to disarm your opponents of their weapons. There are multiple ways to approach each fight and there are a lot of combo's you can do, my personal favourite is shoving a Baddie off a ledge where they'll then fall to their death. 

While not as amazing as the films the Soundtrack in this game is definitely very well done, from the awesome menu theme, to the jungle like soundtrack of Ceylon to mystical horror music when you're in the Emperor's Tomb the Music really gives a great Indiana Jones Atmosphere and i have listened to it on Youtube several times, playing this game without Music turned on is a Mistake, crank it up! 

You'll travel to a variety of locations in this game such as the jungles of Ceylon, the Abandoned castle and dungeons of Prague and more, each level is quite memorable and has their own special chapter which is fun to replay, some levels even have Artifacts which are usually hidden or out of the way from your main goal, collecting all Artifacts will unlock a Special Surprise which i won't spoil. 

Voice Work for the most Part is decent enough, The Voices of your Enemies are often fun to listen to as they call out for backup, taunt you or say funny preset idle voice lines, While Harrison Ford does not voice Indiana in this game the Voice Actor; David Esch (Rest in Piece btw :'( ) Does a very convincing job of sounding just like him, as a Kid i actually had no idea that it wasn't Harrison Ford and i felt a little silly, the Voice Work of the other Characters aren't amazing but they are good enough. 

The Game however is not without its issue's, While much better than the Xbox Original and PS2 Versions the Camera at times can be shoddy especially in tight areas where you need to jump to a rope or ledge and this can get you injured or killed which is annoying, and also the game has some texture glitches which are extremely frequent in the Emperor's Tomb Chapter and the Animations at that point and voice work sometimes is shoddy as well, either it was overlooked or the game at that point was being rushed, its mild issues but still issues all the same. 

Another issue is that the game is quite easy, i'd highly recommend playing on Hard to get a more enjoyable experience, although easily beating the as*es out of your enemies on Easy is still very enjoyable, I've heard that the Black Pearl mod heavily increases the Game's Difficulty but i have not played with that mod. Also this game has a LOT of swimming, i don't find this as big a Criticism as some other people do but its still annoying and the swimming controls are really terrible, moving your mouse at all will throw off your view and will get you stuck, this is a big problem if a Shark is after you as well.

But overall if you're a fan of Indiana Jones there is almost no reason why you should not grab this game, its cheap and has a good length and if you like retracing your steps to obtain artifacts the length of this game would be increased even more so, This game truly makes you feel like you are Indiana Jones and its a damn shame how underrated it is, grab it for full price on Steam and i guarantee you will have an excellent time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093507478', 'num_games_owned': 4756, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1548112215}
review: Данная игра, вышедшая в 2003-ем году, мало чем отличается от своей "коллеги" - Tomb Raider. Основа геймплея хорошо известна каждому, кто знаком с приключениями Лары Крофт. Немного экшена, много прыжков, пара загадок. Emperor’s Tomb никоим образом не собирается ломать устоявшиеся традиции. Практически полный плагиат с одной стороны, но в конечном счёте все зависит от вашего восприятия, от того, что вы хотели бы увидеть. Не будет новшеств, не будет революций в жанре, но будут долгие часы удовольствия для тех из нас, кто считает себя фанатом приключенческих игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080304734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1677120746}
review:
Before I bought and played this game on Steam, I had bought this game for my father back in 2004 for Father's day. I was a little kid, 6-7 years old, with Indiana Jones as my hero growing up. I played this game with my dad several times, but what was left in my memories until now have faded so much. 

Buying this game now, downloading it, and playing it. Probably the greatest amount of nostalgia I have ever felt. Soon to be 21, It is INCREDIBLE how much my brain remembers from this game. Almost every single thing I have encountered thus far I CAN REMEMBER from when I was a kid. 

This version of the game works great, with a minor tweak to the fps the game functions just fine on my rig. I am more than happy with the performance. The graphics aren't all that bad either. Gameplay takes a little getting use to but simple once figured out. 

Many who have never played this game would have a tough time running through it due to the fact it hasn't aged well when compared to modern games. But the game is still worth a playthrough, regardless if it is for pure nostalgia or just out of the love for Indiana Jones.

review: Une excellente nouvelle aventure avec le fameux archéologue. On retrouve tout ce qui a contribué au succès des films bien que les personnages présents soient un peu caricaturaux. author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1546123540}
review:
[code] Hay disponible una traducción al español (España) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1607148685][u]AQUÍ[/u][/url][/code]
[code]Puedes ver más reseñas como esta en la mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta reseña no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Menuda sorpresa me he llevado con este juego. No lo jugué en su día cuando salió al mercado en 2003 y tampoco esperaba demasiado, aunque sí tenía cierta curiosidad por jugarlo para ver cómo era, y la sorpresa ha sido mayúscula. No lo he podido soltar hasta que no me lo he acabado, y la experiencia ha sido más que notable.

Este juego de Indiana Jones bien podría ser una película más dentro de su repertorio, ya que posee un gran argumento al estilo de las películas del famoso arqueólogo. 

Situándose cronológicamente antes de la película “El Templo Maldito”, en esta ocasión Indiana Jones tendrá que recorrer medio mundo siguiendo los pasos de un misterioso artefacto relacionado con el primer emperador chino. Un artefacto que está rodeado de misterio y tras el cual están un misterioso grupo chino y el ejército nazi.

Gracias al planteamiento del guion, podremos visitar gran cantidad de escenarios, a cada cual más variado. Desde la selva amazónica hasta china, pasando por Europa y Oriente Medio. Toda una aventura llena de retos y acción.

Una de las cosas que más me ha gustado de este juego es que mantiene un equilibrio perfecto entre el plataformeo, los puzles y la acción. Esto último me ha parecido de lo mejor del juego, ya que los combates a puñetazos están realmente bien hechos, y se consiguen un número muy variado de combos según como alternemos los golpes.

También me ha gustado bastante la parte plataformera, ya que los saltos, las escaladas o el buceo estarán a la orden del día para encontrar el camino que nos permita seguir avanzando. Mención especial para el uso del látigo de Indiana, el cual está muy bien implementado, saltando de un lado a otro en multitud de ocasiones mientras nos balanceamos en él.

El tema de los puzles también es bastante interesante, aunque por lo general no son demasiado complejos, y a poco que nos esforcemos hallaremos la solución sin quebrarnos demasiado la cabeza. Aunque eso no quiere decir que no sean exigentes muchos de ellos y que no estén muy bien implementados.

El aspecto gráfico también me ha sorprendido bastante, ya que no esperaba demasiado de un juego de 2003, pero he de admitir que el juego se ve bastante bien y aguanta muy dignamente el paso del tiempo. Desgraciadamente, el juego no soporta resoluciones widescreen de base, pero una vez que estás metido de lleno en la aventura, te aseguro que eso será lo último en lo que pienses.

La parte sonora, por otro lado, tiene un nivel excelente. La música es simplemente sensacional, con los temas de esta saga sonando durante toda la aventura, y las voces están muy bien implementadas igualmente, con buenos actores de doblaje.

La versión de Steam no incluye el español, sorprendentemente, pero si visitas el enlace superior de esta reseña, podrás ver una guía donde podrás descargarte un archivo para poner el juego en español, tanto textos como voces.

En definitiva, este juego me ha parecido una maravilla. Toda su propuesta me ha resultado tremendamente entretenida, con acción y exploración a partes iguales y una historia muy aventurera al más puro estilo Indiana Jones.

No te dejes engañar porque sea un título de 2003. Este juego atesora una gran calidad en su interior, y a buen seguro que todo fan de este tipo de juegos lo disfrutará enormemente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992722927', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 110, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1711315609}
review:
This was my childhood game, I'm surprised it even came out on steam! I've been modding it since forever till I switched to windows 10 and lost everything.

Now for a review.

Best game ever.

Ok for real,

The game was made in 2003, of course the graphics won't look as pretty as before,
but in my opinion it's still pretty good for a 2003 game.

Gameplay
- The gameplay is simple, it's like most platformers puzzle games and all that, but what shines in this game,
is the combat mechanic. The hand to hand combat is amazing, You have two buttons, one for right arm and left arm, and combining those two making different combos, some that I've never seen before, is very satisfying. Plus you have that block and dodge mechanic for defense. For the gun fights, it's pretty simple, just target and shoot. Dodge bullets take cover, but the cover system feels wonky compared to others like Uncharted. Also, There is no checkpoints. Which is awful in some levels that are really long then you die at the end, which is very possible in this game.

Story
- The story is good enough, I mean I might be wrong, cause I don't really remember it. I'll keep it spoiler free for people
who haven't played it yet. Yes a spoiler free review for a 2003 game I know... The story goes like an Indiana Jones movie basically, Indy searches for a lost treasures and deals with Nazis and obstacles in you way. But, since it's an Indiana Jones story, Things don't go as planned.

Some problems and fixes
- Now for people who are lazy to check the internet for solutions and write a bad review saying, gaME nOt wOrKiNg! bAd!
Here's a few solution for ya

30 FPS Lock
- For people who are annoyed by it (including me)
1. Go to the game's install directory 
2. Go into GameData > indy 
3. Find the file called 'vars'. 
4. Open it in notepad 
5. The 'FPSLimit' option is pretty close to the top - set the value to 60 instead of 30. 
Apparently you may cause an audio desync in the cutscenes, but I've never experienced that, so who knows
source: https://www.gog.com/forum/indiana_jones_series/indiana_jones_and_the_emperors_tomb_tweaks

Widescreen problems
- Just download this mod, there's no virus, trust me.
https://www.moddb.com/mods/moviesloading-screens-fix-full-screen-1280x960

gAmE's tOo eASy!
- Well I've felt that before and I've found a wonderful mod made by Andrashi
https://www.moddb.com/mods/ijet-dragon-pearl-mod/downloads/dragon-pearl-mod-v10
Basically it makes the game harder by improving the enemies AI, making bullets more rare and by making them more realistic, meaning that you will die. A lot. It also makes you stress when someone holds a gun and points it towards you. Or is that only me?

gRaPhiCs aRe aWfuL
- Well, I was working on a retexture mod making the game look more decent. I'd have to restore everything I lost and it's gonna take me a long time, also because I'm lazy.

Needs more memes
- HA you're in luck! Go see my youtube channel if you want to know more about my cancerous mod I was working on, and if you want it, well go cry on your bed cause I'm done with it! :D
Ok seriously, as soon as I got everything I'll begin to work on it. While I work on it, well feel free to make some yourself, I've left a really bad edited video explaining how I did it, so go watch it if you want!

My youtube channel
- It's very shitty I know
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEUYgf_BPNTwAjr__H38dvg?view_as=subscriber
